Comment: It's nice subtle multiplication problem

âœ… Approved the contribution.
Comment: Good clash @Silver, very clear and looks like a interesting and fun clash.

@Silver, Nice Clash! It initially looked hard to me... I assumed that you had to make the "2 numbers in binary representation" actual binary numbers with the "0b" pre-fix, but then I tried just multiplying them as they were given and felt good until Test 2. I was really scratching my head over how to solve this problem... I'm still quite unsure. ðŸ¤”

Now there are just some simple issues that I'd advise fixing before going on. Here are my thoughts...

STATEMENT:
The statement is extremely clear. So that's fine.

INPUT:
You have written "2 numbers in binary representation", but in the solution code you have called the numbers "number_1" and "number_2"... quite appropriately. I would advise changing your input description like the text below:

<<Line 1:>> [[number_1]] in binary representation
<<Line 2:>> [[number_2]] in binary representation

Putting the <<>> around text will make them appear in bold and the [[]] around text will make them appear as variables, which will make it simpler to read.

OUTPUT:

I'd suggest changing the description to something clearer like: 

"<<Line 1:>> The product of [[number_1]] and [[number_2]], which is also in binary representation."

This would improve the clarity of the description.

CONSTRAINTS:
Blank is good and fine.

TEST-CASES:
Six is a good amount of cases, but if you'd like to add more then it will be more for other coders to work with and higher chance for them to work out how to solve.

OTHER TOPICS:
Please remove the duplicate contribution at the link that @5DN1L has given.
Please consider my advice.

CONCLUSION:
A few improvements that will hopefully help you. Please consider making the specified changes. Your clash is very good @Silver, and I will approve once this contribution is fixed and published for approval... but there are some issues still to work through.

Thanks and Happy Coding!
Code-Parser

Your contribution has been uploaded twice. Please remove one of them. The other link is:
https://www.codingame.com/contribute/view/8423102b29ccef12c7c6a5d2d754ac6324c4e

Hello @5DN1L, is my advice appropriate and sound? Or is there anything you'd like to add/correct?

Thanks,
Code-Parser
Well, thank you for your advice. However, I don't need advice about the statements because this is a reverse CoC anyway.
I don't care about the statement if the author enables Reverse mode only ðŸ˜‰ But I appreciate your efforts!
I make comments only when necessary. ðŸ˜‰
I've done removing the duplicate. Also, I made some small changes

That's cool. Have you had a "parse" through my comment? (Get it? Parse --> Code-Parser?)

I mentioned some ideas for the Input and Output descriptions, which would make your clash clearer for others. I think that some of it would be beneficial...

Anyway, nice work. Keep it up!
Happy Coding,
Code-Parser
